articles.headline: China’s Currency Move Clouds Its Policy Goals
articles.snippet: A month before President Xi Jinping’s visit to Washington, China devalued the renminbi, a move that could inflame critics in Congress.
articles.abstract: A month before President Xi Jinping’s visit to Washington, China devalued the renminbi, a move that could inflame critics in Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — As President Xi Jinping of China prepares for a state visit to Washington next month to smooth over troubled relations, his government has just turned the spotlight back on a recurring issue: the value of his country’s currency.

articles.headline: Arlington, Tex., Officer Is Fired in Fatal Shooting of Christian Taylor
articles.snippet: Officer Brad Miller was dismissed after what was described as a series of troubling decisions that led to the death of Mr. Taylor, an unarmed black 19-year-old.
articles.abstract: Officer Brad Miller was dismissed after what was described as a series of troubling decisions that led to the death of Mr. Taylor, an unarmed black 19-year-old.
articles.lead_paragraph: ARLINGTON, Tex. — A white rookie police officer who shot and killed an unarmed black college football player after the youth had broken into a car dealership in this Dallas suburb was fired on Tuesday for “inappropriate judgment” in his handling of the situation, officials said.
articles.byline: By Patrick McGee and Manny Fernandez

articles.headline: Google Goal in Restructuring as Alphabet: Autonomy
articles.snippet: The Internet giant has been short on details about how its reconfiguration as the entity Alphabet will work. But a look at Nest Labs may provide some clues.
articles.abstract: The Internet giant has been short on details about how its reconfiguration as the entity Alphabet will work. But a look at Nest Labs may provide some clues.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For a glimpse of how Larry Page might envision the way a newly restructured Google will work, take a look at Nest Labs, the company’s Internet-connected thermostat business.

articles.headline: Global Selling Shows Concerns About China’s Weakness
articles.snippet: After China devalued its currency, the price of oil plunged and stock markets fell, reflecting worry that the country’s leaders would be unable to bolster the economy.
articles.abstract: After China devalued its currency, the price of oil plunged and stock markets fell, reflecting worry that the country’s leaders would be unable to bolster the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: After China shocked investors on Tuesday by devaluing the country’s currency, a wave of selling swept the globe. The price of oil plunged, the currencies of other countries tumbled and stock markets skidded on every continent.

articles.headline: Jeb Bush Blames Hillary Clinton and Obama for Iraq’s Decline
articles.snippet: In a blistering attack, Mr. Bush said the early withdrawal of American troops set the stage for the chaos now sweeping the region.
articles.abstract: In a blistering attack, Mr. Bush said the early withdrawal of American troops set the stage for the chaos now sweeping the region.
articles.lead_paragraph: SIMI VALLEY, Calif. — The war in Iraq, which dominated American presidential politics in 2004 and 2008, has returned as an issue in 2016. This time, the argument is not over whether the United States should have gone to war, but rather how the Obama administration sought to end it.

articles.headline: Handling of Donald Trump Puts Fox News on the Spot
articles.snippet: If there is a war between Donald Trump and Fox News, it is an unconventional one. It is not mutually assured destruction; it is mutually beneficial combat.
articles.abstract: If there is a war between Donald Trump and Fox News, it is an unconventional one. It is not mutually assured destruction; it is mutually beneficial combat.
articles.lead_paragraph: It started with Megyn Kelly’s interrogation of Donald J. Trump at Thursday night’s debate on Fox News. Mr. Trump wasted no time responding, in less than presidential terms. The network’s chief executive, Roger E. Ailes, intervened, placating Mr. Trump while also defending his star anchor, Ms. Kelly.

articles.headline: Alibaba Revenue Misses Expectations; $4 Billion Stock Buyback Is Planned
articles.snippet: The Chinese e-commerce giant has had a turbulent first year as a public company, and its stock price has fallen about 35 percent from its November 2014 highs.
articles.abstract: The Chinese e-commerce giant has had a turbulent first year as a public company, and its stock price has fallen about 35 percent from its November 2014 highs.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — A year ago, executives of the Chinese e-commerce company Alibaba were preparing a roadshow that paved the way for one of the biggest initial public offerings of stock in history.
